H0.text: A cell is the level of structural organization that best describes blood, which is a fluid made up of several different parts.

H1.text: A tissue is the level of structural organization that best describes blood, a fluid made up of several different parts.

H2.text: An organ is the level of structural organization that best describes blood, a fluid made up of several different parts.

H3.text: A system is the level of structural organization that best describes blood, which is a fluid made up of several different parts.

A4.text: In terms of anatomy and histology, blood is considered a specialized form of connective tissue.
